title: The dark side of The Biggest Loser revealed by a former contestant
text:
She lost 24kg on the first season of Big Brother Australia in 2006.

But on Thursday, Tracy Moores slammed the reality show for making her cry during one of its 'traumatising' segments.

The 57-year-old mother-of-three said contestants were subjected to degrading challenges and went to extreme lengths to lose weight.

The dark side of The Biggest Loser: Ex-contestant Tracy Moores (pictured) revealed on Thursday night's episode of The Feed that she was 'traumatised' by the show's challenges

Tracy recalled a segment in which she and her fellow contestants were made to 'look like a bunch of pigs' after being surprised by a room full of junk food.

'I was quite distraught about the whole thing, we were quite traumatised to the point where I was crying,' she said on SBS's The Feed.

She also slammed another challenge that saw contestants pull an aeroplane across hot tarmac on a 40°C day.

Cruel: Tracy recalled a segment (pictured) in which she and her fellow contestants were made to 'look like a bunch of pigs' after being surprised by a room full of junk food

'We looked over and we were all standing in the sun and we were given hot water. The crew were under umbrellas with bottles of water with ice,' she said.

'I actually went over and said, "Can we get some cold water?" And they said, "No, your water's over there".'

Tracy explained that off screen the participants spent a minimum of 'two-and-a-half to three hours' a day on treadmills to lose weight.

'Some of the contestants had enemas, they shaved all the hair off their body, they didn't eat. They looked like The Walking Dead!' she added.

Pressure: Tracy claimed that contestants also used extreme dieting methods, including taking caffeine pills and eating less than 500 calories per day

Tracy claimed that contestants also used extreme dieting methods, including taking caffeine pills and eating less than 500 calories per day.

The 'intense' conditions resulted in Tracy being put on a drip due to severe dehydration on New Year's Eve in 2005.

This isn't the first time Tracy has criticised the weight loss show. In 2015, she said it was 'just a matter of time until someone has a heart attack and dies' on set.

The eleventh and final season of the Biggest Loser aired in 2017.
